body: `akka.http.server.request-timeout=120 s` helped me, not sure if it's a "idiomatic" solution though.

So, Akka Http default value for request timeout is 20 seconds, [according to the docs](http://doc.akka.io/docs/akka-http/current/scala/http/common/timeouts.html#request-timeout). The default value is [overridden by Play in `AkkaHttpServer`](http://doc.akka.io/docs/akka-http/current/scala/http/common/timeouts.html#request-timeout) if the the properties  `play.server.akka.http.idleTimeout` ([defaults to 75 seconds](https://github.com/playframework/playframework/blob/2.6.0-M2/framework/src/play-akka-http-server/src/main/resources/reference.conf#L16-L19)) and `play.server.akka.http.requestTimeout` are configured.

#6992 just declared a necessary property, but it did not give it a default value and then the Akka Http default is being used.

@ScalaWilliam can you confirm that configuring `play.server.akka.http.requestTimeout` is possible and then the problem is solved?

I'm not sure if we have a default value for Netty Server in 2.5.x, but if we have, we can keep that behavior for 2.6.0.

issue.title: idleTimeout documentation for akka backend in 2.6 is wrong

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

body:
As observed in #7172, the correct properties are:

1. `play.server.http.idleTimeout` (or `https`) for server idle timeout and
2. `play.server.akka.requestTimeout` for request timeout.

We should correct the docs and also make these configuration more consistent.

issue.title: AkkaHttpConfiguration issue - documentation seems not correct

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.title: Consistent configuration for idleTimeout in Akka HTTP server backend

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
## Fixes

Fixes #7172.

## Purpose

Now `play.server.akka.http.idleTimeout` is derived from `play.server.http.idleTimeout` so that we these existing options will be respected by Akka HTTP server backend. The docs were also improved to clarify these with Akka HTTP specific settings (in the namespace
`akka.http.server`).

## References

See also #7067.
